edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image

Interface WritableImage

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Collection<ImageCoordinate>, Image, Iterable<ImageCoordinate>, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    WritableImageImpl

    public interface WritableImage
extends Image
    Represents a read/write multidimensional image with some pixel data and associated metadata.

    Author:
    Colin J. Fuller
    See Also:
    for full description.

    This interface requires methods for both reading and writing; if using an image that will not be modified, specify that using {@link Image}.

      Convenience method for converting a single Image with non-singleton color dimension into a List of Images with singleton color dimension, each containing the Image for a single color channel.

    • Method Detail

      • resize

        void resize(ImageCoordinate newSize)
        Resizes the image to the size specified in the ImageCoordinate.

        Any image data that is still within the bounds of the new size will be transfered. Other image data will be discarded; regions previously outside the image will be filled with zeros.

        Any existing box of interest will be erased on calling this method.

        Parameters:
        newSize - an ImageCoordinate containing the new size of each dimension of the image.

      • copy

        void copy(Image other)
        Copies the pixel values of another Image into this Image. Any existing pixel values are overwritten. Metadata is not copied. The two Images must be the same size; this is not checked.
        Parameters:
        other - The Image whose pixel values will be copied.

      • setValue

        void setValue(ImageCoordinate coord,
            float value)
        Sets the value of the Image at the specified Image Coordinate. No bounds checking is performed.
        Parameters:
        coord - The ImageCoordinate at which to set the Image's value.
        value - The value to which to set the Image at the specified coordinate.

      • split

        List<Image> split(int dimension)
        Method for converting a single Image with non-singleton specified dimension into a List of Images with singleton specified dimension, each containing the Image for a single point along that dimension.

        Images will be returned in the List in the order of their dimension index in the original Image.

        Specified by:
        split in interface Image
        Returns:
        A List of Images, each with one point from the original Image.

      • splitChannels

        List<Image> splitChannels()
        Convenience method for converting a single Image with non-singleton color dimension into a List of Images with singleton color dimension, each containing the Image for a single color channel.

        Images will be returned in the List in the order of their color dimension index in the original Image.

        Specified by:
        splitChannels in interface Image
        Returns:
        A List of Images, each with one color channel from the original Image.
